attributes.action: Freeze MPs salaries who resign from their party until new by-elections are held
attributes.background: MPs are elected on a manifesto. When they quit their party they're going against their manifesto therefore they no longer represent their party or the people who voted them into office.  If you don't represent your party  or your constituents why should they be paid?

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
